sn2.8:1.2: Tāyana means “defender” (here the affix -ana is agentive). Compare Vedic trātṛ, “defender”, an epithet of Indra (eg. Rig Veda 2.23.8, 6.25.7).
sn2.8:2.1: These verses are often recited by mendicants to remind them of their commitment.
sn2.8:2.4: As, for example, the gods of universal beauty (AN 7.44:4.1). Tāyana taught rebirth in the Brahmā realm as the goal of his spiritual life, as did other religious founders of the past (AN 6.54, AN 7.73, AN 7.74, AN 7.66).
